articles.description: Tokyo, Japan – Scientists from Tokyo Metropolitan University have shown that 5-aminolevulinic acid (5-ALA) helps bypass deficiencies in Complex I (CI), the first in a series of protein complexes that transport electrons and help power the mitochondria. They s…
articles.content: image: Flies with Complex I deficiency cannot activate the cascade of reactions required to make ATP. When fed 5-ALA+SFC, other protein complexes such as Complex II and IV are more active and help by… [+3698 chars]
